The barndo was immaculate and comfortable. Despite being directly behind the owner’s space, it felt private and was very quiet. My kids loved checking out the horse and goats, and they made besties with the kitten who stopped by to check us out. The coffee and cocoa bar was so well stocked, and there were plentiful snacks, breakfast options, filtered water, and cooking basics. My kids loved making popcorn in the air popper and using the popcorn bags. Both beds were comfy, and the living room had three recliners, an electric fireplace, and some cozy blankets that made for a nice place to unwind and watch a movie after our drive. My kids loved playing the games that were available and I appreciated that there was plenty of space for them to get some energy out by running around outside. Our family was in town for a reunion around the entombment of my parents cremains. It was stressful but we were able to wind down together (4 adults, 2 young people) at the end of each day. Because of the location we had gorgeous views of the night sky with little light pollution and town was within walking distance. I highly recommend booking this house if you are coming to the Cherryvale area. There are lots of things to do in the area: Fishing, hunting, historic places, and cultural events are all within walk and/or driving distance. Our family came from California, North Dakota, and Alaska and we are in consensus: this house was perfect for us in every way.

We were welcomed with so many “extras” including a well stocked coffee /popcorn bar & breakfast/snack items. Rented the Kusel House for a family wedding held at the Cedar Tree Barn (right around the corner) that rolled into the Thanksgiving 2023 holiday. I don't think this review captures the gratitude and appreciation our camp had for the Kusel House. Truly home away from home. G-Maps doesn't take you directly to the house using its street address. Called Kelly to find it. Each room clean, fully stocked, and equipped with strong broadcasting Wi-Fi throughout the house (huge plus). Clean, comfortable, and maintained outside deck and yards. Many people commented on the possible business connection the house has to the Cedar Tree Barn around the corner. I thought the downstairs (mancave and bar) is where the real added value was. A gracious and thoughtful host, Kelly was quick to offer, respond, and act on our needs. Highly recommend the Kusel House.
